verses.verse: When I would have healed<WH7495> Israel,<WH3478> then the iniquity<WH5771> of Ephraim<WH669> was discovered,<WH1540> and the wickedness<WH7451> of Samaria:<WH8111> for they commit<WH6466> falsehood;<WH8267> and the thief<WH1590> comes<WH935> in, and the troop<WH1416> of robbers spoils<WH6584> without.<WH2351>

And they consider<WH559> not in their hearts<WH3824> that I remember<WH2142> all<WH3605> their wickedness:<WH7451> now their own doings<WH4611> have beset<WH5437> them about;<WH5437> they are before<WH5048> my face.<WH6440>
They make the king<WH4428> glad<WH8056> with their wickedness,<WH7451> and the princes<WH8269> with their lies.<WH3585>

They are all<WH3605> adulterers,<WH5003> as an oven<WH8574> heated<WH1197> by the baker,<WH644> who ceases<WH7673> from raising<WH5782> after he has kneaded<WH3888> the dough,<WH1217> until<WH5704> it be leavened.<WH2557>
In the day<WH3117> of our king<WH4428> the princes<WH8269> have made him sick<WH2470> with bottles<WH2573> of wine;<WH3196> he stretched<WH4900> out his hand<WH3027> with scorners.<WH3945>

For they have made ready<WH7126> their heart<WH3820> like an oven,<WH8574> whiles they lie in wait:<WH693> their baker<WH644> sleeps<WH3463> all<WH3605> the night;<WH3915> in the morning<WH1242> it burns<WH1197> as a flaming<WH3852> fire.<WH784>

They are all<WH3605> hot<WH2552> as an oven,<WH8574> and have devoured<WH398> their judges;<WH8199> all<WH3605> their kings<WH4428> are fallen:<WH5307> there is none<WH369> among them that calls<WH7121> to me.
Ephraim,<WH669> he has mixed<WH1101> himself<WH1931> among the people;<WH5971> Ephraim<WH669> is a cake<WH5692> not turned.<WH2015>
Strangers<WH2114> have devoured<WH398> his strength,<WH3581> and he knows<WH3045> it not: yes,<WH1571> gray<WH7872> hairs are here<WH2236> and there on him, yet he knows<WH3045> not.

And the pride<WH1347> of Israel<WH3478> testifies<WH6030> to his face:<WH6440> and they do not return<WH7725> to the LORD<WH3068> their God,<WH430> nor<WH3808> seek<WH1245> him for all<WH3605> this.<WH2063>
Ephraim<WH669> also is like a silly<WH6601> dove<WH3123> without<WH369> heart:<WH3820> they call<WH7121> to Egypt,<WH4714> they go<WH1980> to Assyria.<WH804>

When<WH834> they shall go,<WH3212> I will spread<WH6566> my net<WH7568> on them; I will bring<WH3381> them down<WH3381> as the fowls<WH5775> of the heaven;<WH8064> I will chastise<WH3256> them, as their congregation<WH5712> has heard.<WH8085>

Woe<WH188> to them! for they have fled<WH5074> from me: destruction<WH7701> to them! because<WH3588> they have transgressed<WH6586> against me: though I have redeemed<WH6299> them, yet they have spoken<WH1696> lies<WH3576> against<WH5921> me.

And they have not cried<WH2199> to me with their heart,<WH3820> when<WH3588> they howled<WH3213> on their beds:<WH4904> they assemble<WH1481> themselves for corn<WH1715> and wine,<WH8492> and they rebel<WH5493> against me.
Though I have bound<WH3256> and strengthened<WH2388> their arms,<WH2220> yet do they imagine<WH2803> mischief<WH7451> against<WH413> me.

They return,<WH7725> but not to the most<WH5920> High:<WH5920> they are like a deceitful<WH7423> bow:<WH7198> their princes<WH8269> shall fall<WH5307> by the sword<WH2719> for the rage<WH2195> of their tongue:<WH3956> this<WH2097> shall be their derision<WH3932> in the land<WH776> of Egypt.<WH4714>
